intro: Mitrasacme graminea, commonly known as the slender mitrasacme, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with white or pale yellow petals. The plant is noted for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
